eu.cassandra.sim
Class StandAloneSimulation

java.lang.Object
  eu.cassandra.sim.Simulation
      eu.cassandra.sim.StandAloneSimulation

public class StandAloneSimulation
extends Simulation

The StandAloneSimulation class includes an implementation of the setupScenario() method that parses a properly formatted input text file and
(a) sets up the installations (or installation types) to be included in the simulation,
(b) sets up the pricing scheme(s) to be used in the simulation,
(c) defines the set of simulation parameters to be used and, in case of dynamic scenarios,
(d) the demographic data, according to which the entities involved in the simulation will be instantiated.

Author:
Fani A. Tzima (fani [dot] tzima [at] iti [dot] gr)

Constructor Detail

StandAloneSimulation

public StandAloneSimulation(java.lang.String outputPath,
                            java.lang.String dbName,
                            int seed,
                            boolean useDerby)
Instantiates a new stand alone simulation, whose scenario setup is stored in a properly formatted input file.

Parameters:
outputPath - the path to the output directory
dbName - the name of the database where output data will be stored
seed - the seed for the random number generator
useDerby - whether to use MongoDB (false) or Apache Derby (true) for storing simulation output data
Method Detail

setupScenario

public java.util.Vector<Installation> setupScenario()
Specific implementation of the setupScenario method that parses the information required to setup a scenario from a properly formatted input file.

Specified by:
setupScenario in class Simulation
Returns:
the vector of installation (types) to be used in the simulation

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method. Parses the scenario input file, sets up and runs the simulation, and, finally, outputs results.

Parameters:
args - The table of arguments. Two arguments are required: "setup_file_name" and "ouput_dir_path". If more than two arguments are provided, the ones after the first two are ignored. If less than two arguments are provided, simulation is run using the default values "properties.txt" and "./", respectively.
